page.title: 20Ecology
page.content: The gentle slopes of the chalk hills with their wooded areas make this a delightful place to live.In Spring the beech trees,clad in soft delicate green,with shafts of sunlight catching the bluebells make the woods an inspiring place to walk.In Autumn the many hues of the leaves are an equally commanding sight which can herald a winter of icy and snowy "excitement" for car owners who use the hills and children who sledge on the Common. Wildlife is here in plenty for those who are observant.There are deer, badgers,foxes,rabbits,squirrels and many smaller mammals and for the ornithologist kestrels,sparrow hawks, owls and jays as well as the common woodland and garden birds. The information for this "D" block has been collected by Class 2,Downley Middle School under Mrs.Jo.Patience.
